Dear Holly Anderton:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has been at a staff member's personal home while AWOL.
While AWOL, the youth got a tattoo with the staff member and the
staff member gave a youth a blunt to get high. The staff member
also had the youth steal for her at a movie theatre.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed via phone on February 12,
2025, and face to face at the facility, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Administrator reported Youth A disclosed these
allegations to her directly. She reported Staff 1 is put on
administrative leave pending this investigation. Administrator
reported when Youth A disclosed this information, she did ask
Staff 1 if any youth from the facility has ever been to her home,
and she denied this ever occurring. She reported after this face-to-
face conversation Staff 1 sent Administrator a text message
stating Staff 2 had brought Youth A to her home before in
November 2024.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2025, and February 27, 2025, in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she finally decided to tell
the truth about Staff 1. When asked to explain more, Youth A
reported she recently found out Staff 1 was calling her best
friend’s parents. She reported when she was at school, she used
a friend’s cell phone and saw her best friend’s father was trying to
get a hold of her. Youth A reported she talked to her best friend’s
father who reported Staff 1 was saying she had to quit because of
Youth A threatening her and Staff 1 trying to “hook up” with her
best friend’s father. When asked how Staff 1 would get her best
friend’s father’s contact information, Youth A reported she has had
Staff 1 call him before for her on Staff 1’s cell phone. Youth A
reported that she has been to Staff 1’s home on three occasions
that she can remember. She reported she would go AWOL from
the facility and then talk to Staff 1 via social media, specifically
SnapChat, to come to pick her up. She reported she has been at
both apartments Staff 1 has lived at. Youth A reported at Staff 1’s
old apartment she went there and got a tattoo on her forearm. She
reported Staff 1 had an underground artist named “Vincent” come
2

to the home to give her a tattoo. Youth A reported Staff 1 did not
get a tattoo during that time from “Vincent”. She reported during
that time Staff 1 also smoked marijuana with her. Youth A
reported she only took “one hit off the blunt before she got her
tattoo.” She reported another time she went to Staff 1’s home after
getting a tattoo on her neck. Youth A denied Staff 1 took her to get
that tattoo but stated she did go back to her apartment after that
tattoo. She reported there was a third time she went to Staff 1’s
apartment where she spent the night. She reported the other two
times she was at Staff 1’s apartment was only for a couple of
hours. Youth A reported she cannot remember the dates of when
this all occurred. She reported she was at Staff 1’s old apartment
twice and her new apartment once. Youth A was asked how she
got back to the facility, she reported there was one time when her
therapist called her to check in and had Staff 1 drop her off at a
Family Dollar to get picked up. She reported the other two times,
Staff 1 would drop her off at apartments that are near the facility
so Youth A could walk back to the facility. She reported one time
Staff 1 saw a staff member when driving Youth A back to the
facility and told Youth A to duck so that she would not get caught.
Youth A was able to show on a map where Staff 1’s apartment
was located. She denied any other staff member transporting her
to Staff 1’s home. When asked if Staff 1 took her anywhere else,
she denied Staff 1 ever taking her out while she was at her
apartment because Staff 1 did not want to get caught. Youth A
reported at the facility Staff 1 would take her on outings. She
reported on one outing to the movies, it was just Youth A and Staff
1. Youth A reported a male friend of Staff 1’s came into the
agency van and smoked a cigarette while Youth A was in the van.
She reported another time, Staff 1 took Youth A and Youth B to
the movies. While at the movies, Staff 1 had Youth A and Youth B
steal candy for her.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
her goal within her job is help coach the youth at the facility
through the system and noted that she has lived experience, so it
is easy for her to relate to the youth. She reported she has
crossed a boundary with Youth A. When asked to explain more,
Staff 1 reported Youth A can relate a lot to Staff 1’s personal
experience and they both have a lot of the same common
acquaintances in the local community. Staff 1 reported Youth A
became very dependent on her and upset when Staff 1 would
speak to other youth, especially Youth C. She reported she has
tried to not show favoritism with the youth and wants to be a
mentor to all the youth, but Youth A becomes very upset about
3

this and feels Staff 1 is betraying her. When asked if Youth A has
ever went to Staff 1’s home, she reported she had only come to
her home once and that is because Staff 2 brought Youth A their
due to Youth A struggling emotionally. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was only there for 10-15 minutes. Staff 1 could not remember
what day this occurred on. She denied ever providing Youth A
marijuana or having marijuana at her home. Staff 1 reported she
never wanted to tell on Staff 2 for bringing Youth A over to her
home. She denied Youth A ever coming to her home when Youth
A went AWOL. Staff 1 confirmed her address being the exact
address that Youth A picked out on the map. When it was brought
to Staff 1’s attention that Youth A could pick out her home on a
map, Staff 1 continued to state it was only one time and she lives
at an easy location to find on the map. Staff 1 was asked if she
knew a person named “Vincent” and she reported he is a tattoo
artist that comes to people’s homes to do tattoos. She reported he
is well known in the community and confirmed he has come to her
home before to do a tattoo on her leg. She denied ever
introducing this tattoo artist to Youth A and reported Youth A
knows him due to being from the community. Staff 1 reported the
tattoo Youth A got on her arm was from a girl at her school and
denied ever taking Youth A to get a tattoo. When asked if she has
taken the youth to the movies before, Staff 1 confirmed that she
would take youth on outings often to the movies. She denied ever
allowing the youth to steal candy from the movies and stated they
had the agency’s credit card to get snacks for the youth. When
asked if she ever met up with one of her friends at the movies,
Staff 1 denied this ever happening. She reported she does not
ever remember seeing her friends at the movies when she has
brought the youth. Staff 1 denied sharing her social media
information with the youth. She reported that some youths do
have her personal phone number for when they need to get
picked up from visits. Staff 1 confirmed staff are not supposed to
have youth at their home, but she was just trying to be a support
for Youth A who was struggling that day and Staff 2 did not know
what to do.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth B reported she used to go to the movies all the time with
Staff 1. She reported she had never seen any of Staff 1’s friends
or family members when she went to the movies. Youth B denied
ever seeing anyone steal snacks from the movies. She denied
staff ever sharing their personal information with her including
where staff live or their social media information.
4

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth C reported Staff 1 is her favorite staff at the facility. When
asked to explain more, Youth C reported Staff 1 has been like a
mentor to her and is always there for her when she is upset. She
reported Staff 1 has taught her new coping skills and helped her
get a job. Youth C reported Staff 1 has talked with her about
potentially doing an independent living placement with Youth C
once she has completed the programming at the facility and it is
approved by Administrator and Youth C’s foster care team. She
reported she has never went to Staff 1’s home but she has seen
Staff 1’s home via Facetime on another staff member’s phone
when Youth C wanted to process with Staff 1 on her day off.
Youth C denied Staff 1 ever giving her personal information, such
as where Staff 1 lives or her social media information. She
reported staff at the facility are not allowed to share that type of
information.
Staff 2 was interview via video conference on Teams on
February 24, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff
2 reported she has never heard concerns from Youth A about
Staff 1. She reported Youth A was upset with Staff 1 a couple of
weeks ago because Staff 1 was talking with Youth C. When asked
to explain more, Staff 2 reported Staff 1 had told Youth A before
that in the future Youth A could potentially stay with her as an
independent living placement and Youth A overheard Staff 1
telling Youth C that Youth C could also potentially stay with Staff 1
as an independent living placement when discharged. Staff 2
reported she does not have a close relationship with Staff 1. She
reported she has not seen any concerns with Staff 1’s work ethic.
Staff 2 reported she has taken Youth A on outings before and
described these outings as out for a drive or out to dinner. She
denied ever taking Youth A to Staff 1’s home. When Staff 2 was
asked if youth are allowed to go to staff members’ homes, Staff 2
denied that being allowed and denied youth even being allowed to
have personal information about staff. Staff 2 was asked if she
knew where Youth A had gotten her tattoos from, she reported
she only knew about Youth A getting her neck tattoo done by a
“gang member” while she was AWOL. Staff 2 reported that is what
she heard from someone at the facility but could not remember
who. She reported she did not know where or when Youth A got
her other tattoos.
Supervisor was interview via video conference on Teams on
February 24, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor reported on February 8, 2025, Youth A had come out
5

of her room expressing frustrations about Staff 1. He reported
Youth A was upset that Staff 1 was talking with a father of one of
her friends and saying Youth A was threatening to harm Staff 1.
Youth A then went on to state she was going to tell on Staff 1 and
reported she had gone to Staff 1’s home. Supervisor reported
Youth A never disclosed anything happening at Staff 1’s home
and never went into full detail. He reported this information to
Administrator. Supervisor reported he has never heard of any
concerns about Staff 1 having poor boundaries with Youth A or
any other concerns about Staff 1’s work ethic. He reported Youth
A has never disclosed where she got her tattoos from. When
asked if youth are allowed to go to staff member’s homes or if staff
are allowed to share their social media information with youth at
the facility, Supervisor explained they are not allowed to do that.
Supervisor reported staff are taught to maintain professional
boundaries with the youth and youth are not allowed to come to
staff’s homes even when AWOL.
Probation Officer was interviewed via phone on February 12,
2025. Probation Officer reported Youth A disclosed this
information to her on Monday February 10, 2025, when Youth A
reported she needed to tell her the truth. She reported Youth A
stated she went to Staff 1’s personal home when she had run
away from the facility. Probation officer reported Youth A did get a
tattoo during one of the times she was AWOL but was unaware it
was when Youth A was with Staff 1.
Documents Reviewed:
- Text Message from Staff 1 to Administrator dated
February 11, 2025- Staff 1 sent a text message to
Administrator: “Actually now that I think about it Staff 2 did
bring Youth A to my house one time when they were on a
car ride a few months ago on a Weds I don’t remember the
exact day and they were in the Ford. It was either a Sunday
or Wednesday. I never said anything to protect Staff 2’s
job.” Administrator asked Staff 1 why Staff 2 brought Youth
A and Staff 1 said, “to vent; it was in November.”
- Facility Incident Report dated June 7, 2024- Youth A
went AWOL at 2:24pm after getting upset after a meeting
with her case manager. Staff followed Youth A when she
walked out of the home and attempted to verbally redirect
her. All AWOL protocols were followed. Staff did witness
Youth A getting into a black van.
- Facility Incident Report dated June 7, 2024- Youth A
returned from AWOL back to the facility at 10:00pm. Upon
6

return Youth A showed off her new tattoo on her forearm.
She reported that her boyfriend was the one to pick her up
in the black van.
- Facility Incident Report dated October 21, 2024- Youth
A returned from AWOL at 10:30pm to the facility. It was
reported Youth A had a new tattoo on her neck.
- Facility Policy- Youth Development Specialist
Procedures most recent revision date of 02/2022- Within
this policy it states that staff are to maintain clear and
appropriate boundaries with youth. It states specifically,
“Staff are to have clear boundaries with youth related to
their personal life which includes maintaining separation
between work and family. Staff will not be taking youth to
their home, visit with friends or family while off campus with
youth, or having friends or family come to the facility to
visit.”
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- Staff 1 has received
one disciplinary action which resulted in a verbal waring on
09/18/2024 due to Staff 1 making comments to staff in front
of a youth about if a youth was not requested to leave the
facility she would quit. Staff 1 is up to date on all required
trainings and has reviewed appropriate boundary setting
with youth in January 2024. On 02/24/2025, Staff 1 was
provided a termination letter due to Staff 1 admitting a
youth being to her home and also speaking with a youth’s
kin about them, resulting in a violation of the facility’s
Confidentiality Statement.
- Human Resource File for Staff 2- Staff 2 has no
disciplinary actions noted within her HR file. Staff 2 is up to
date on all required training and has reviewed appropriate
boundary setting with youth in February 2025.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 did not follow the
Youth Development Specialist Procedures as she admitted to
allowing Youth A to come to her home. Staff 1 reported she did
cross boundaries with Youth A as they had a stronger bond due to
similar life experiences. Due to that stronger relationship, Staff 1
reported Youth A became jealous when Staff 1 would work with
other youth, hence why she believes Youth A reported these
allegations. Youth A reported she has been to Staff 1’s home
several times, she has gotten a tattoo at Staff 1’s home and was
provided marijuana at Staff 1’s home. Staff 1 reported Youth A
has been to her home but denied any tattoos occurring at her
home or providing Youth A with any marijuana. Youth A also
7

reported Staff 1 had Youth A and Youth B steal snacks at the
movie theatre. Youth B and Staff 1 denied this ever occurring.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4130 Privacy and Confidentiality
Section (1) An institution shall assure resident and parent privacy and
Description confidentiality and shall protect residents from exploitation.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 violated the confidentiality policy of the facility.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 13, 2025, and February 27, 2025, in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she recently found out
Staff 1 was calling her best friend’s parents. She reported when
she was at school, she used a friend’s cell phone and saw her
best friend’s father was trying to get a hold of her. Youth A
reported she talked to her best friend’s father who reported Staff 1
had said she had to quit because of Youth A threatening her and
Staff 1 trying to “hook up” with her best friend’s father. When
asked how Staff 1 would get her best friend’s father’s contact
information, Youth A reported she has had Staff 1 call him before
for her on Staff 1’s cell phone.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
in her interview that she did violate HIPPA. When asked to
explain, Staff 1 reported since Youth A has a lot of common
acquaintances, she talked to Youth A’s best friend’s father on the
phone about Youth A. She reported Youth A was threatening her
to have gang members come to kill her because Youth A was
upset with her. Staff 1 reported she did not feel safe and did not
feel supported by Administrator about these threats. She reported
that is why she broke HIPPA and talked to Youth A’s friend’s
father. Staff 1 reported she did not have permission from the
facility to speak to Youth A’s friend’s father.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Administrator reported she was made aware of these concerns
and noted Staff 1 had filed a police report. She reported the plan
8

was to have Staff 1 work at another part of the agency and away
from Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
- Human Resource File for Staff 1- Staff 1 has received
one disciplinary action which resulted in a verbal waring on
09/18/2024 due to Staff 1 talking making comments to staff
in front of a youth about if a youth was not requested to
leave the facility she would quit. Staff 1 is up to date on all
required trainings and completed HIPP/Confidentially
training in January 2025. On 02/24/2025, Staff 1 was
provided a termination letter due to Staff 1 admitting a
youth being to her home and also speaking with a youth’s
kin about them, resulting in a violation of the facility’s
Confidentiality Statement.
- Facility Confidentially Statement- This statement notes
that the staff member has reviewed the facility
Confidentially policy. The statement notes the staff
understands that all confidential material must be protected
within and outside of the Agency. The staff member will not
discuss client information except as authorized. Staff 1
signed this document on 10/12/2023
- Facility Confidentiality Policy most recent revision date
of 05/2024- The policy notes confidential information must
not be disclosed without written consent unless permissible
by law. Unauthorized disclosure of confidential or privileged
information is a serious violation of the facility’s
confidentially policy and is subject to disciplinary action up
to and including termination.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 reported she
violated the confidentially policy by speaking to Youth A’s kin
about Youth A without permission from the facility.
Conclusion Violation Established
9

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
